news.title: Man sentenced to life in prison for mother’s murder at her Co Kerry home three years ago
news.summary: A 55-year-old Kerry man has been sentenced to life imprisonment for the “violent” murder of his “wonderful” and “hardworking” mother - described as someone who “always had a smile for everyone” - whom he strangled to death at her Killarney home three years ago.

news.title: ‘Great error of judgment’: Regina Doherty says it’s ‘hard to accept’ Ceann Comhairle’s explanation over Sinn Féin photo call
news.summary: Fine Gael MEP Regina Doherty has said it is “hard to accept” the explanation from Ceann Comhairle Verona Murphy about her decision to pose for a photograph with Sinn Féin TDs and senators.

news.title: Employers warned of €50,000 fines and imprisonment for breaching new pension scheme rules
news.summary: Employers have been warned they may face fines of up to €50,000 and imprisonment for breaching the rules of the new national auto-enrolment pension scheme called My Future Fund.

news.title: Munster excited to get the ‘big rig’ Edwin Edogbo fired up again after his return from injury
news.summary: Had things worked out differently for Edwin Edogbo this month, he would likely have returned to Munster as a senior Ireland international.

news.title: New blow for health insurance customers as Irish Life to again hike premiums
news.summary: Health insurance customers are being hit with a new price rise at a time when more than one million policyholders are about to renew their cover.

news.title: ‘I had a question mark over my sexuality for a long time’ – Louise McSharry comes out as gay
news.summary: Writer and podcaster Louise McSharry has come out as a gay woman on the latest episode of her podcast.

news.title: Money experts share the Black Friday deals they’ll be snapping up today – and the ones to avoid
news.summary: FOMO (fear of missing out) is a real thing in many scenarios, especially on the now mega-marketing holiday that is Black Friday. Trying to tame that fear will be key when surrounded by so much temptation.

news.title: Kildare man to be hit with $900,000 judgment in Florida fraud case
news.summary: A firm owned by a US lawyer is set to be awarded almost $900,000 (€776,000) in compensation and damages against Ireland-based businessman Paul Wright after a magistrate in Florida recommended that a judge there adopt a default final judgment against him.

news.title: Olivia Petter: ‘Cowardly, flaky, childish’ – why we women are sick of men in their 30s
news.summary: Men in their 30s are, according to my recent WhatsApp conversations at least, “flaky”, “children”, “quite dull”, “cowardly”, “a project”, “awful at expressing their feelings” and “mostly either chumps or liars”.

news.title: Modern Morals: ‘I’m in a new relationship and I like him, but an old flame reached out and I’m tempted to reply. Should I?’
